message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this product that I believe is worth a lot to you. I'm asking for $12,000 for it. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I think it's a bit pricey. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for it. Can you consider that?

Bob, I appreciate your interest. While I understand your perspective on the price, I'm still firm on the value of this product. I'm willing to come down to $11,000. It's a fair price, considering the value you'll receive.
I understand that you're firm on the value of the product, but I'm still looking for a better deal. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for it. Can you consider that?
Bob, I'm willing to meet you halfway.  $10,500 is my final offer.  If we can't agree on this price, I'll be moving on to other potential buyers.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $9,800 for it. Can you consider that?

Bob, I'm going to be upfront -  $10,000 is my absolute minimum.  It's a fair price for both of us, considering the value of the product.  If you're not willing to go that high, I'll have to look at other options.
